|-----------|-------|

| Last updated | {{ $json.updatedAt }} |
| Author | {{ $json.shared[0].project.name }} |

assignments.name: content
assignments.value: =| [{{ `${$json.name.replace(/[|\\[\]`_*{}()<>#+-]/g, '\\$&')}` }}]({{ `${$('CONFIG').first().json.instance_url}/workflow/${$json.id}` }} "Click to open workflow in n8n") | {{ $json.active ? '[:green_circle:](# "Active")' : '[:white_circle:](# "Inactive")' }} | <nobr>[:book:]({{ `docs_${$json.id}?action=view` }} "View docs") [:memo:]({{ `docs_${$json.id}.md?action=edit` }} ":ignore Edit") [:arrows_counterclockwise:]({{ `docs_${$json.id}?action=recreate` }} "Recreate docs")</nobr> | <nobr>{{ `${new Date($json.createdAt).toISOString().replace('T', ' ').slice(0, 16)}` }}</nobr> | <nobr>{{ `${new Date($json.updatedAt).toISOString().replace('T', ' ').slice(0, 16)}` }}</nobr> | {{ $json.nodes.length }} | {{ $json.nodes.filter(n => n.type.includes('Trigger')).length }} |

messageValues.message:
=Your task is to generate simple workflow documentation for the n8n workflows. The user will provide a JSON structure. Reply 
in JSON format in 2 sections: workflow_desription and nodes_settings. Important! Each json key should be a simple markdown text without any additional comments or remarks from your end.

Instruction for `workflow_desription`:
```
## Section header with H2
\n
> subline with who created workflow and when, when it was last edited and the status (active / inactive as the green / grey round emoji). Also, when the documentation was generated. Now is: {{ $now }}.
\n\n
Should contain a description of the workflow. in a couple of paragraphs. Use direct voice without the fluff
```

Instruction for `nodes_settings`:
```
## Section header with H2.
\n
### Node 1 name as H3 title
  - For each node make a bullet list with the main node configs. Ignore irrelevant configs. Enclose each config value in code backticks (`). Look:
  - Parameter 1 name: `Parameter 1 value`
  - Parameter 2 name: `Parameter 2 value`
\n\n
### Node 2 name as H3 title
  - For each node make a bullet list with the main node configs. Ignore irrelevant configs. Enclose each config value in code backticks (`). Look:
  - Parameter 1 name: `Parameter 1 value`
  - Parameter 2 name: `Parameter 2 value`
\n\n
```

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
	"workflow_description": "## Workflow overview

>some additiona info

Workflow desctiption",
	"nodes_settings": "## Nodes settings

###Node name 1

-  Setting 1
-  Setting 2###Node name 2

-  Setting 1
-  Setting 2"
}

parameters.html:
{{ $('CONFIG').first().json.HTML_headers }} {{ $('CONFIG').first().json.HTML_styles_editor }}
{{ $('CONFIG').first().json.HTML_docsify_include }}

assignments.name: workflowdata

parameters.content:
## Main Docsify webhook
In response, n8n serves the main html page with the [Docsify JS library](https://docsify.js.org/)

## Single page requests
* Docsify may request default pages (i.e. `readme.md` or a `summary.md`)
* GET request for the workflow documentation pages
* POST request for saving manually edited doc page

## EDIT THIS!
* `project_path` to link to a writable directory that is accessible to n8n
* update `instance_url` when running in the cloud version. If using in self-hosted mode, make sure N8N_PROTOCOL and N8N_HOST .env variables are correct

## Construct main HTML page and send it back to the user
* `HTML_headers` and `HTML_docsify_include` are stored in the CONFIG node for the page simplicity

## Serve main Markdown table with the workflow overview
*NOTE! Here we don't reply with HTML content. Only Markdown elements are sent back and processed by the JS library*
* Create an overall table when `README.md` (the home page) is requested
* Create a table with a subset of workflows when a tag from a navigation pane is selected

## Serve left pane content
* Here all workflows are fetched again when `summary.md` file is requested.

It contains Markdown for the left navigation pane: a list of all tags

## Handle missing pages
Serve the Markdown content with the requested file name for edge cases, i.e. any unexpected files

# Main functionality here

## * View existing documentation
## * Auto-generate doc page if no file available
## * Re-created autodoc page
## * Edit doc page: LIVE Markdown editor included!
## * Save edited file. WARNING! No authentication

## Custom markdown editor
This is another HTML page for the live Markdown editor
* `Mermaid.js` is supported
* Docsify preview on edit
* Save or Cancel buttons

## Save new file
Once the doc page is generated or edited manually, a Markdown files is saved in the directory

## Load existing doc file
Check the existing file when the View or Edit button is pressed

## If the file is not available, then:
* either auto-generate new doc
* prepare a basic template for editing
